related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (johnkennyuk) experiencing issues with account linking.
* Current account linking flow is outdated and not straightforward.
* User prefers to keep their personal domain linked to their Google account.
* Issue may be caused by a capitalization issue in the email address.

**Problems Identified:**

* Two separate accounts were created due to a bug in earlier versions of the application.
* User's personal domain is not linked to their Google account.
* New auth service is not yet released.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered to merge the two accounts and guide the user through the account linking flow.
* User tried to resolve the issue themselves but encountered further problems.
* Mark-at-pieces reset the user's GitHub account and suggested waiting for the new auth service to be released.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new auth service is still under development and expected to be released in early/mid March 2025.
* User successfully linked their accounts using the new auth app but in the wrong order.
* User requested a reset to relink their accounts in the correct order.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of proper account linking and the need for a more user-friendly flow.
* It also demonstrates the challenges that can arise due to bugs in earlier versions of an application.
* The user's patience and willingness to wait for the new auth service is appreciated.

related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Several users reported being unable to link their Google account to Pieces after the 11.3.0 update. 
* Attempting to login through the Pieces toolbar or Pieces Desktop app results in an infinite loading loop on https://authentication.pieces.services/.
* The issue occurs on Windows 11.

**Problems identified:**

* A bug in the new authentication flow introduced in version 11.3.0.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces support identified the problem and implemented a fix within a few hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The authentication issue is resolved. Users are able to link their Google accounts and login to Pieces successfully.

**Additional notes:**

* Users were asked to provide support logs for troubleshooting.
* The issue appears to be specific to Windows 11.

**I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any other questions.**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App installation and startup on Windows and Linux. Problems included invalid port errors, database corruption, and login failures. Solutions involved running installations with admin rights, manual folder creation, and updates addressing hardware compatibility and installation processes.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Key Points Raised:**

* SherlockSol encountered an issue where the Pieces app wouldn't launch on their Windows PC. 
* They received an error message "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect."
* Other users reported similar experiences, including uzaxirr.

**Problems Identified:**

* The root cause of the issue was the installation process not requesting admin rights, resulting in an inability to bind to a local port.
* This issue affected both PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Nathan-courtney-pieces requested log files and additional information about SherlockSol's machine.
* Mack-at-pieces suggested a video call for further troubleshooting.
* Zedevmed discovered a solution by installing PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop app using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session, granting admin rights.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue seems to be resolved for zedevmed by running the installation with admin privileges.
* Tsavo-at-pieces is working on updating the documentation to promote the MSIX or winget installation methods for both PiecesOS and PFD to ensure proper access rights. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The specific steps for installing PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop app using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session can be found in the documentation provided by zedevmed.
* This issue was discussed in the support Github page for Pieces from March 17th, 2025 to April 16th, 2025.

* User (antoine79) experiencing database bootup issue.
* User attempts to fix the issue by deleting the database folder but encounters the same problem with the latest version (11.3.1). 
* User reports the issue after the latest update and provides detailed information about their operating system, application version, and logs.
* Another user (NidroySoft) provides similar information and encounters the same error.

**Problems Identified:**

* Initial bootup issue with the database.
* Incomplete installation process not creating the necessary subfolder.
* Hardware limitations (lack of AVX2 support) causing incompatibility with CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Potential fix identified by Pieces Support team with additional logging in version 11.3.1.
* User manually creates the missing subfolder.
* Pieces Support team acknowledges the core issue and pushes a fix in version 11.3.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.
* Pieces Support team thanks the users for their patience and feedback.

## Additional Notes:

* The issue was caused by a combination of incomplete installation and hardware limitations.
* The fix involved accounting for these cases and making the necessary adjustments.
* The issue highlights the importance of clear and detailed communication between users and support teams.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption on Startup
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing crashes or failures to launch Pieces OS due to database corruption. The issue appears across different OS versions (11.0.0, 11.3.0, 11.3.1) and operating systems (macOS, Windows). Error messages point to an uninitialized database. Proposed solutions include bug fixes in later versions (11.3.2) and manually creating missing subfolders.

## Summary of Github Issue #686

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (antoine79) experiencing database bootup issue.
* User attempts to fix the issue by deleting the database folder but encounters the same problem with the latest version (11.3.1). 
* User reports the issue after the latest update and provides detailed information about their operating system, application version, and logs.
* Another user (NidroySoft) provides similar information and encounters the same error.

**Problems Identified:**

* Initial bootup issue with the database.
* Incomplete installation process not creating the necessary subfolder.
* Hardware limitations (lack of AVX2 support) causing incompatibility with CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Potential fix identified by Pieces Support team with additional logging in version 11.3.1.
* User manually creates the missing subfolder.
* Pieces Support team acknowledges the core issue and pushes a fix in version 11.3.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.
* Pieces Support team thanks the users for their patience and feedback.

## Additional Notes:

* The issue was caused by a combination of incomplete installation and hardware limitations.
* The fix involved accounting for these cases and making the necessary adjustments.
* The issue highlights the importance of clear and detailed communication between users and support teams.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.

**Gather Detailed Logs:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system information when reporting issues to facilitate faster troubleshooting and resolution.
